title: Random artifacts / graphical glitches?
content: This started today, random artifacts can show up on any page, even on an embedded youtube video preview. Browser is up to date, any idea what's causing this?

title: Kétlépcsős hitelesítés (2 factor authentication)
content:
Üdvözlöm A problémám a kétlépcsős hitelesítés beállításával van. Google Authenticator applikációval próbálom a fiókomat beállítani, de a QR-kód beolvasása után amit kiad kódot az alkalmazás, nem fogadja el a Firefox, így nem engedi beállítani a védelmet. Mit tudok ilyenkor tenni?

Welcome My problem is with setting up two-step authentication. I am trying to set up my account with the Google Authenticator application, but after scanning the QR code, the code that the application brings up is not accepted by Firefox, so it does not allow me to set up the protection. What can I do in this situation?
creator: zsotlee94

title: broke
content: Firefox says I am up to date. FedEx and Best Buy says I need to update Firefox in order to get on their site

title: Firefox is too slow after update
content: Before updating the browser it run smoothly but when I update it every time I opened my websitehttps://tinyjunction.com/ kids help show errors and say wait or exit and loaded for a time. Not even my site when I open even facebook same error will appears.
creator: annanexus

title: Inbox does not display
content:
When I refresh my inbox, the items appear and then immediately disappear. All of my folders are still visible and when I open a folder, I can see all of the items and they do not disappear. I am running MS Outlook on a Macbook Pro with macOS Ventura 13.3.

My inbox is visible on both my iPhone and iPad. It is only on the MacBook that the inbox disappears.

John



/edit: moved thread from Firefox for iOS (for iPhone/iPad) to Firefox section as you have macOS and not iOS.
creator: jrwecker

title: Firefox não segue configuração de tecla com xmodmap no Linux
content: Precisei configurar as funções da tecla 105 no Linux com o comando: $ xmodmap -e 'keycode 105 = slash question degree' Todos os aplicativos seguem a configuração, menos o Firefox onde a tecla 105 continua com a função de Ctrl. Como eu configuro o Firefox para ele obedecer a configuração do xmodmap e não seguir a configuração original da tecla 105?
creator: FraterLinux
